text:
During Installation, Apache installs itself as a service (named Apache2, i
think). Not on my machine. The only visible Service is "Apache", remaining from
the previously installed httpd 1.3.20 after de-installation. 
The Service called "Apache" is shown in "Services", but not in the Apache
Service Monitor (ASM). When I am right in reading my installation(.msi)-logfile,
msi finds a Service called "Apache2", but this is shown neither in "Services"
nor in ASM.
RegEdit shows an entry "Apache2" in
HKLM/System/ControlSet001/Enum/Root/LEGACY_APACHE2 with "Apache2" as DeviceDesc
and  as Service (same with ControlSet002 and CurrentControlSet).
Since there is no service visible, apache can't start. How do I get the service
visible and/or running?
creator: w.flamme@web.de
Thomas.Calrke@tellmi.demon.co.uk
text:
Did you stop the service before de instalation?

Another point to try is romoving the previous service running for apache.

Deinstalling apche 2.0
Manualy deinstaling anything left.
Then removing all registry keys (not many).
AND INSTALING 2.0 form scratch.

Although i recantly did the same thing but to NT and had no problem.
Although i had checked this all first!

It's what i did and had no problem!!!

Please attach your .msi logfile to this report (as text/plain).

  This could be a problem isolated to Apache Monitor.  Can you start and stop
  the Apache2 service from the Windows service control manager?
creator: wrowe@apache.org
w.flamme@web.de
text:
I just tried to install apache 1.3.26. This version shows up in the Apache
Service Monitor as well as in Windows service control manager. And it runs ;-)
But even a new install of 2.0.39 does not bring "Apache2"-service into sight.

The event monitor shows following entries from my attempts to install apache 2:
2002-06-27, 07:46:05: The Apache service named  reported the following error:
>>> (32548)Address already in use: make_sock: could not bind to address
10.4.2.221:80     . 
2002-06-27, 07:46:05: The Apache service named  reported the following error:
>>> no listening sockets available, shutting down     .
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 8925 ***
creator: wrowe@apache.org
